name: The factorial base expansion of a(n) corresponds to the restricted growth sequence of that of n (when read from right to left).
comment: We ignore nonleading zeros in factorial base expansions.
link: Rémy Sigrist, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5039
Index entries for sequences related to factorial base representation
example: The first terms, in decimal and in factorial base, are:
program: (PARI) a(n) = { my (v = 0, m = Map(), u = 0, d, c); for (r = 2, oo, if (n==0, return (v), d = n%r; n \= r; if (!mapisdefined(m, d, &c), mapput(m, d, c=u++);); v += c*(r-1)!;);); }
xref: See A382269 for a similar sequence.
author: _Rémy Sigrist_, Mar 21 2025
